result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:12 AM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris, Defendant Joseph Franklin Swartz in court.  Attorney Matthew Dobbe in court for Joseph Franklin Swartz.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM78 & 22CM347.  Atty Dobbe states an offer was received from the State, believes the DE would like to represent themselves but wondering if Atty Dobbe could be a "standby" if needed.  Court schedules trial. FPT date is cut off for negotiations.  If not resolved State and Defense to file instructions, Motions and Witness Lists.  22CM78 will be number 1 for trial and 22CM347 would be number 2.  Parties to have a conversation prior to FPT including DE to discuss details and negotiations.  DE to contact PD's office before leaving today to see if he now qualifies for PD.  Court suspends DE's current Atty payment plan until January.  DE confirms address and phone number.  Adjourned at 8:19 AM. bph
